nodes.text: Lirka was a Sephi female who lived in the last years of the Galactic Republic. Along with a colleague, she assisted the Sephi politician Navi in his senatorial duties during the Clone Wars, until he was arrested for crimes against the Republic in 22 BBY.

A female of the Sephi species, Lirka lived during the waning decades of the Galactic Republic. By the time of the Clone Wars, a pan–galactic conflict between the Republic and the Separatist Confederacy, she had gotten involved in politics. She served as an aide to Senator Navi, who represented their homeworld of Thustra and the whole Sumitra sector in the Republic Senate. She shared her duties with another Sephi woman, and the two dressed in an almost identical fashion.

In 22 BBY, Senator Navi was found guilty of crimes against the Republic and conspiracy to commit murder on Yoda, Grand Master of the Jedi Order. He was arrested by the Jedi Master Mace Windu in the middle of a Senate plenary session. Lirka and her counterpart were present in the Senate's Grand Convocation Chamber when that happened, and the two expressed shock and dismay over the incident, as two Senate Guards were taking their superior into custody.

Around 22 BBY, Lirka was still a youthful Sephi. She had pink, smooth skin and sported straight, dark-brown hair that reached below the knees in the back. When seating in the Senate, she wore a close-fitting red-and-gold tunic with bell-shaped sleeves and a pair of black, over-the-knee boots with high heels. She also used a red folding fan as a fashion accessory.

Lirka and her colleague only appeared in the 2004 comic Jedi: Yoda, the fifth and final issue in the Star Wars: Jedi series of comics, written by Jeremy Barlow and illustrated by HOON. The two Sephi aides featured in the comic were mostly identical, with one wearing black cuissardes and the other white ones. Even though the aides were only background characters and had no lines, HOON still produced a detailed rendering of the one wearing black boots as part of his conceptual "sephi character catalogue." Although unnamed in the comic, that character was identified as "Senator Aid Lirka" in the aforementioned piece of concept art.
